content.raw: OK. Pending bugfixes I'm done with this now. It was a lot of work, and I now understand why I've never seen a Qt app (other than BLACS) with drag-drop tabs before. It's practically a quarter of the length of the actual Qt code for the tab bar itself, and given the normal python to C++ verbosity ratio, that means you're reimplementing a decent chunk of the behaviour of the whole thing just to get the tabs to move.
